content: I’ve been one of your Ninja Writers for a few months now, but about a month ago I joined Scribophile.com. It’s a membership site for writers (with both free and paid versions) where you can post writing for critique in exchange for critiquing other people’s work. I’ve had a lot of fun going over other people’s work and making suggestions for improvement, and it’s been a learning process also, since seeing what other people are tripping up on in their fiction leads to the question of whether I’m doing the same thing without realizing it. That learning got even more intense when I posted my short story, and got some really good critiques back. The people critiquing were positive and encouraging, but they also called me on some bad habits and the occasional lazy bit of writing I was doing. Scribophile probably isn’t the best place to develop an audience, as members are all writers (and aspiring writers) rather than the general reading public, but is sure is a good place to learn to write better.
